Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flaring walls and everted rim, red slipped and polished on the interior and exterior, and decorated on the interior in white pigment with triangles filled with cross-hatching depending from the rim. Three triangles are preserved, presumably there were originally four.
Curator's comments: Interior decoration illustrated in drawing in Petrie, Naqada and Ballas (London 1896), pl. xxviii. 26 Shape and decoration like White cross line ware C20L in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked 394 near base.
Condition: fair - incomplete; Three-quarters of rim missing; paint has come off in many places, leaving ghost impressions of designs.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
